Children would prioritize their own needs and wants over the needs of adults, which could lead to a society that is more focused on play and fun than on work and productivity.
Children might not have the same level of understanding or experience as adults, which could lead to poor decision-making and a lack of stability in government and other institutions.
Children may not have the same level of patience and tolerance as adults, which could lead to more conflict and violence in society.
Children may not have the same level of empathy and understanding as adults, which could lead to a lack of consideration for the needs and feelings of others.
Children may not have the same level of discipline and responsibility as adults, which could lead to a lack of structure and order in society.
